text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Pebble Beach | settlement_type = Unincorporated place | other_name = | native_name = | image_skyline = Lone Cypress.jpg | image_caption = The Lone Cypress, an icon of the region, as seen from 17-Mile Drive | nickname = | pushpin_map = California | pushpin_label = Pebble Beach | pushpin_relief = yes | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Monterey Peninsula | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = United States | subdivision_type1 = State | subdivision_name1 = California | subdivision_type2 = County | subdivision_name2 = Monterey | established_title = Rancho Pescadero (Barreto) | established_date = Established early 19th Century | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_ft = 0 | elevation_m = 0 | timezone = Pacific | utc_offset = −8 | timezone_DST = PDT | utc_offset_DST = −7 | postal_code_type = ZIP code | postal_code = 93953 | area_code_type = Area code | area_code = 831 | blank_name = GNIS feature ID | blank_info = | official_name = }} Pebble Beach is an unincorporated community on the Monterey Peninsula in Monterey County, California, United States. The small coastal residential community of mostly single-family homes is notable as a resort destination, and the home of several golf courses. Nonresidents are charged a toll to use 17-Mile Drive, the main road through Pebble Beach. ==History== Pebble Beach was originally a rocky cove and seashore that was once part of the Rancho Pescadero Mexican land grant. In the 1850s, Chinese immigrants formed a series of fishing settlements along Carmel Bay including one at Stillwater Cove, next to Pebble Beach. They collected abalone and various fish. In 1860, businessman David Jacks bought the Rancho, then sold it in 1880 to the Pacific Improvement Company. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in California Category:Settlements in Monterey County, California
title: Pebble Beach, California
